intro: Bastardia densiflora var. paraguariensis, commonly known as Paraguayan bastardia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Paraguay and Brazil. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high sunlight exposure. Its dense flowering habit and vibrant colors make it a notable species in its native habitat.
